alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 11:27AM EST until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Abrigador Trail is underwater and minor flooding of homes occurs along Abrigador Trail and Willow Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:47 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet Thursday and then remain near steady into the weekend. There is a risk for ice jams to form. Any ice jam formation could cause rapid fluctuations in the river level. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
